title: Mentoring Program for Online Lecture Development and Strengthening Social Studies Teaching Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced social studies theories (history, geography, politics, economics) and advanced applied skills (digital content creation)
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric limited technological environment, emphasizing collaborative and feedback-driven practical training among social studies instructors. Highlights project-based learning for solving local community issues.

learning_goals: Through mentoring, learners can apply three effective instructional strategies (e.g., historical case analysis, geographic information visualization, civic participation simulation) when designing online social studies courses.
Learners continuously improve their own social studies course materials (e.g., cultural comparison texts, political system diagrams) based on peer feedback.
Learners implement two online interaction techniques (e.g., virtual field trip discussions, policy proposal collaboration activities) to enhance social studies learner engagement.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
